result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Return date on January 29, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas B. Brown in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases.  DE appeared at 2 pm instead of his set hearing time of 11:00 a.m. today.  Atty Lawton explains earlier nonappearance by DE.  Says DE will be requesting new counsel and requests warrants be quashed and plea/sent be reset.  Court so orders.  Return date scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 01:00 pm. Defendant Nicholas B. Brown appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney. DE does qualify for PD representation. 
State moves to dismiss 14CM568 and refiles 14CF322.  Court dismisses 14CM568 and addresses 14CF322.   State requests $250.00 Cash bond on 14CF322.  Atty. ORourke requests PA Bond.
